required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: miRNA-155 Assay Before and After Immunotherapy and Probiotics
clinical_study.official_title: MicroRNA-155 Assay in Childhood Allergic Rhinitis Before and After Combined Sublingual Immunotherapy and Probiotics

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to explore miRNA-155 change in response to sublingual immunotherapy (SLIT), probiotics and combined treatment with SLIT and probiotics in AR children.

detailed_description.textblock: Allergic rhinitis (AR) is an inflammatory state characterized by a disturbance of immunoregulatory mechanisms that leads to an amplified T helper "Th-2" response. Micro-RNAs (miRNAs) are short single-stranded RNA molecules that post transcriptionally control gene expression and can mediate allergic process. The aim of this study was to explore miRNA-155 change in response to sublingual immunotherapy (SLIT), probiotics and combined treatment with SLIT and probiotics in AR children.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Group I included 15 cases who received probiotics only. Group II included 15 children who received SLIT. Group III included 15 children who received probiotics and SLIT.

primary_outcome.measure: Total nasal symptom score between before and after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Total Nasal Symptom Score was evaluated for the three groups at the start of the study and after 6 months. TNSS is the sum of scores for each of nasal obstruction, sneezing, nasal itching, and rhinorrhea at each time point, by means of a four-point scale (0-3) . TNSS is estimated by addition of the score for each of the symptoms to a total out of 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum miR-155 expression at the start and end of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Serum miR-155 expression was measured for the three groups by quantitative real time PCR

arm_group.description: consisted of 15 cases who received probiotics only. A drug called Lacteol fort (Rameda Company) . A sachet was taken once daily for three months. Each sachet contains 10 billions lactobacilli.
included 15 children who received SLIT for 6 months. Standardized Timothy Grass Pollen (Phleum pratense)

included 15 children who received probiotics and SLIT. A drug called Lacteol fort was administered A sachet was taken once daily for 3 months . Standardized Timothy Grass Pollen was taken for 6 months

intervention.description: Lacteol fort is a drug containing lactobacilli
SLIT includes 2 phases build up and maintenance phases. (Jubilant HollisterStier LLC 14110 Collections Drive, Chicago USA) .

intervention.intervention_name: Lacteol fort and Standardized Timothy Grass Pollen
intervention.description: Lacteol fort is a drug containing lactobacilli and the Standardized Timothy Grass Pollen includes 2 phases build up and maintenance phases.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 5-18 years
- Diagnosed as having AR
- With positive skin test to grass pollen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anatomical abnormalities of upper respiratory tract,
- Previous immunotherapy,
- Clinically significant inï¬‚ammatory diseases,
- Malignancies,
- Chronic treatment with systemic corticosteroids or immune suppressive drugs

reference.citation: Livak KJ, Schmittgen TD. Analysis of relative gene expression data using real-time quantitative PCR and the 2(-Delta Delta C(T)) Method. Methods. 2001 Dec;25(4):402-8.
Cox L. Sublingual immunotherapy and allergic rhinitis. Curr Allergy Asthma Rep. 2008 Apr;8(2):102-10. Review.
